prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating the Base Rectangular Prism 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with zero rotation and translation. 2. Draw the first face of the sketch on the XY plane using a single rectangular loop, which consists of four lines. The first line starts at (0,0) and ends at (0.4191,0); the second line starts at (0.4191,0) and ends at (0.4191,0.75); the third line starts at (0.4191,0.75) and ends at (0,0.75); the fourth line starts at (0,0.75) and ends at (0,0). 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: Euler Angles [0, 0, 0] and Translation Vector [0, 0, 0.011]. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal by 0.011 units, creating a rectangular prism. Part 2: Building the Central Opening 1. Create a new coordinate system at the point (0.0551, 0.364, 0) with zero rotation. 2. Draw the first face of the sketch on the XY plane using a single rectangular loop, which consists of four lines. The first line starts at (0,0) and ends at (0.3088,0); the second line starts at (0.3088,0) and ends at (0.3088,0.0221); the third line starts at (0.3088,0.0221) and ends at (0,0.0221); the fourth line starts at (0,0.0221) and ends at (0,0). 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3088. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: Euler Angles [0, 0, 0] and Translation Vector [0.0551, 0.364, 0]. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal by 0.0221 units, creating a join with the base prism. The resulting CAD model is a rectangular prism with a central rectangular opening and a triangular cutout on one of its faces. The overall dimensions are approximately 0.75 units by 0.75 units by 0.035 units, accounting for the central opening and extrusion depths.</description>

At this point, you will have created a three-dimensional rectangular prism base. **Part 2: Triangular Prism Top** 1. **Create a new coordinate system** for the top part. This will create a triangular prism on top of the rectangular prism base. The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a pointed, triangular top.
